channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

item.title: At least 73 dead and thousands injured after massive explosion rocks Beirut
Conflicting reports on what caused the explosion
Videos show moment of massive Beirut blast
item.description: A large explosion ripped through the Lebanese capital Beirut, injuring people and smashing windows in buildings across the city.

item.title: Trump on America's Covid-19 death toll: 'It is what it is'
Reporter reveals the simple secret to exposing Trump's lies
item.description: Jonathan Swan, a reporter for Axios, has revealed the magic words that expose President Donald Trump's lies for what they are.

item.title: Watch President Trump's Axios interview
item.description: President Trump sat down with Axios reporter Jonathan Swan to discuss a wide variety of topics including the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: There's still a long way to go in the pandemic, WHO official says
Right-wing media focuses on 'imaginary controversy' suggesting Biden won't debate Trump
Inside Trump's TikTok reversal
Keilar pushes back on Trump campaign claims of voter fraud
item.description: CNN's Brianna Keilar fact checks Trump campaign senior adviser Mercedes Schlapp's position that mail in voting can lead to election fraud.

item.title: Trump defends wishing Ghislaine Maxwell well
item.description: President Donald Trump is now saying that he wished Ghislaine Maxwell well after she was arrested because he doesn't want her to die in jail like her former boyfriend and alleged accomplice, Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Isaias turns deadly and spawns tornadoes as it races up the US East Coast
item.description: Hurricane Isaias slammed into North Carolina Monday night, bringing coastal and inland flooding with the storm that is expected to keep moving up the coast.

item.title: Police feared a man was murdered. Five years later, he's been found living in dense woodland
item.description: A Lithuanian man who disappeared in Britain almost five years ago and became the subject of a murder inquiry has been found living in dense undergrowth.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds and Blake Lively 'deeply and unreservedly sorry' for plantation wedding
item.description: Ryan Reynolds says he and his wife, Blake Lively, still feel sorry about holding their 2012 wedding on a former plantation in South Carolina.

item.title: 'SOS' in the sand saves Pacific island mariners
item.description: An "SOS" message written on the beach of a tiny Pacific island pointed rescuers to three missing mariners, United States and Australian authorities said Tuesday.

item.title: Rafa Nadal opts out of defending US Open title
item.description: Citing the "complicated" nature of the world under the pandemic, Rafael Nadal has opted not to defend his US Open title later this month in Flushing Meadows, New York.

item.title: 'So shameful': CNN political director reacts to Trump's comments on John Lewis
item.description: CNN political director David Chalian responds to President Donald Trump's comments on late congressman and civil rights icon John Lewis, calling them "shameful."

item.title: North Korea's work on nuclear weapons includes 'miniaturized' devices, report says
item.description: North Korea is continuing work on its nuclear program and several countries believe Pyongyang has made gains in producing ballistic missiles with small nuclear devices attached, according to a confidential United Nations (UN) report, a UN diplomat told CNN.

item.title: Trump cites Lewis' decision to not attend inauguration to downplay legacy of civil rights icon
item.description: President Donald Trump downplayed the legacy of the late civil rights icon John Lewis in a new interview, instead repeatedly pointing to the Georgia Democrat's decision to not attend his 2017 inauguration.

item.title: The US sent Brazil millions of hydroxychloroquine doses. Months later, they're still in storage
item.description: It was the kind of gift that should have come with a return slip.

item.title: We're facing a 'generational catastrophe' in education, UN warns
item.description: The world is facing a "generational catastrophe" because of school closures during the coronavirus pandemic, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned Tuesday.

item.title: CNN anchor: Trump calls Dr. Birx pathetic after she tells the truth
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett criticizes President Donald Trump for saying coronavirus task force member Deborah Birx was "pathetic" for caving to Democrats after she after she warned the pandemic is "extraordinarily widespread" in the US.

item.title: The little-known story of the Navy women codebreakers who helped Allied forces win WWII
item.description: In the annals of military codebreaking history, there is perhaps no site more famous than Bletchley Park -- the vast, English estate that produced vital intelligence and helped the Allies prevail in World War II.

item.title: Amazon was selling shoes using the N-word until a UK lawmaker complained
London has endured plagues, fires, and wars. Will it weather Covid-19?
item.description: The impact of Covid-19 is being felt in London, where previously bustling streets are now often deserted and some shops are still shuttered. But the British capital has a long history of enduring hardship. CNN's Phil Black reports.

item.title: Audi pulls 'insensitive' ad featuring girl eating banana in front of car
item.description: Audi has apologized for an advert showing a young girl eating a banana in front of a premium car, admitting it was "insensitive" and promising not to use the image in future.

item.title: The correct way to make tea? Science weighs in on microwaving vs. kettle
item.description: An American woman's TikTok guide to making hot tea that went viral in June had Brits tut-tutting in horror over their morning cuppa -- largely because of the controversial use of a microwave rather than a kettle to heat water.

item.title: City installs female figures on traffic lights in campaign for gender equality
item.description: Mumbai's traffic lights are about to look a little different.

item.title: UK to roll out millions of 90-minute tests. Doctor says US could do the same
item.description: According to the UK's Department of Health, the British government has procured "millions" of two separate coronavirus tests that can detect not only coronavirus but several other viruses, providing "on-the-spot results in under 90 minutes." Dr. Ashish Jha, Director of the Harvard Global Health Institute, says the US has the ability to do the same thing.

item.title: China saved the giant panda, but conservation efforts ignored other species, says new study
item.description: China has spent decades working to save its iconic giant panda and has celebrated real success in recent years, but those efforts have failed to protect leopards and other large carnivores that share its habitats.

item.title: Couple dies in same week of coronavirus leaving behind teen son
item.description: 17-year-old Justin Hunter tells CNN's Chris Cuomo about losing both of his parents, Angie and Eugene Hunter, to coronavirus in the same week.

item.title: India's Modi to lay foundation stone at divisive temple despite rise in coronavirus cases
item.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to lay a foundation stone for the construction of a Hindu temple at a holy site that's been at the center of the country's most politically and culturally divisive land dispute.

item.title: Covid-19 is mutating. Here's what that means
item.description: CNN's Sanjay Gupta explains how viruses mutate and why we needn't always be worried when they do.

item.title: Tourist snaps the toes off 19th-century statue while posing for photo
item.description: Police in Italy have identified a 50-year-old Austrian man who broke three toes off a statue at a museum as he posed for a photo with the artwork.

item.title: Can the world's oldest restaurant escape the pandemic's grasp?
item.description: Restaurante Botín, a cozy eatery in Madrid, Spain, was founded in 1725 and holds the Guinness World Record for being the world's oldest restaurant.

item.title: This village in India plants 111 trees every time a girl is born
item.description: In many parts of India, baby boys are favored over girls, who—due to the dowry system—can be seen as a financial burden on families. But the people of Piplantri are fighting this prejudice. In Piplantri, villagers celebrate the birth of their girls by planting 111 trees for each infant. The ritual began after Shyam Sunder Paliwal lost his teenage daughter, Kiran, and planted a tree in her honor. Today, he is leading the charge to ensure the girls of Piplantri are protected from harm and educated so they can grow up to be independent and self-sufficient. The trees are now becoming a source of beauty, sustenance and growth for the girls and the village as a whole.

item.title: 'Midnight Sun' is finally here and 'Twilight' fans are binge-reading it
item.description: It's been 12 long years since the last book of the "Twilight" series came out, meaning high schoolers that once classified themselves into #TeamJacob or #TeamEdward are now working adults.

item.title: Surfers have unexpected greeting with a pair of whales
item.description: Beachgoers in Australia got a closeup view of two southern right whales just off Manly Beach in Sydney.

item.title: EPL players can now be red carded for deliberately coughing at opponent
item.description: Footballers who deliberately cough towards an opponent could receive a red card under new Covid-19 guidelines published by the English Football Association (FA).

item.title: Alexis Ohanian on being married to Serena and his future hopes for Olympia
item.description: Alexis Olympia Ohanian Jr., isn't yet three years old, but already her future looks bright -- her parents are making it so.

item.title: Teams set for the world's most lucrative football match, worth a possible $346 million
item.description: London clubs Brentford and Fulham will contest what's been dubbed the world's most valuable football match on Tuesday as they battle it out in the Championship play-off final.

item.title: EVA Air introduces special flight to nowhere on a Hello Kitty plane
item.description: Taiwan continues to cater to the needs of its travel-starved population by offering yet another aviation experience that doesn't actually take you anywhere.

item.title: School principal parodies 'U Can't Touch This' to teach CDC rules
item.description: A high school principal in Alabama parodied MC Hammer's "U Can't Touch This" to encourage students to be safe when they return to school in the fall.

item.title: Conflicting reports on what caused the explosion
'Just when we thought it couldn't get worse, it did': Residents describe explosion
In pictures: Photos show scale of damage after massive blast
item.description: An explosion in the Lebanese capital of Beirut has killed at least 50 people and injured more than 2,750, according to Health Minister Hamad Hassan.

item.title: Inside Trump's TikTok reversal
item.description: • ByteDance CEO: This is Trump's real goal for TikTok • China accuses US of trying to steal TikTok

item.title: Trump on America's Covid-19 death toll: 'It is what it is'
item.description: • Trump fumbles over death toll numbers • Birx stung by first public attack from Trump

item.title: Birx stung by first public attack from Trump
item.description: Dr. Deborah Birx was stung by President Donald Trump's tweet criticizing her after she offered what she believed was an accurate assessment of the current state of coronavirus outbreaks in the US, a person familiar with her reaction told CNN Tuesday.

item.title: Opinion: What Trump would have to do to win
item.description: Splitting the atom changed everything, Einstein reputedly said, except the way we think.
